description: Paybook is a hub that connects people with their financial world! Through bank connectivity and innovative technology, Paybook's solutions foster productivity and fiscal clarity to improve the lives and operations of individuals and businesses around the globe.Integrate your software solutions with financial institutions, government agencies, and utility service providers for a steady flow of financial data and digital stamping services.
steps: Create an profile for a new API credentials https://www.paybook.com/w/sync
After creation profile , you will see apiKey

blocks.name: getSessionToken
blocks.description: Create a session token.Sessions are access tokens for the final user in order to consume Sync endpoints. Sessions expire after 5 minutes of inactivity and should be used for creating or updating credentials.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Developer Token given on the developer.

args.name: userId
args.info: Id of the user.

blocks.name: getAccountTypes
blocks.description: Return account types.Catalogues are a collection of endpoints that are relevant to the data segmentation on some of the other endpoints.

args.name: sessionToken
args.info: Session token, this value can be obtain using token and subtoken from get getSessionToken.

args.name: fields
args.info: Select fields to be returned.

args.name: skip
args.info: Skip rows to be returned.

args.name: limit
args.info: Limit the number of rows to be returned.

args.name: order
args.info: Order the rows to be returned.

blocks.name: getUserByApiKey
blocks.description: Returns users for that token.Users are logical segmentations for end-users. It's a best practice to register users in order to have their information grouped and have control on both ends. It is required to have at least one user registered to create credentials.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Developer Token given on the developer.

args.name: idExternal
args.info: External ID.

args.name: skip
args.info: Skip rows to be returned.

args.name: limit
args.info: Limit the number of rows to be returned.

args.name: order
args.info: Order the rows to be returned.

blocks.name: createUser
blocks.description: Create a new user.Users are logical segmentations for end-users. It's a best practice to register users in order to have their information grouped and have control on both ends. It is required to have at least one user registered to create credentials.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Developer Token given on the developer.

args.name: idExternal
args.info: External ID, this field can be null and be used to keep track of that user with an external ID.

args.name: name
args.info: User name.

blocks.name: updateUser
blocks.description: Update user.Users are logical segmentations for end-users. It's a best practice to register users in order to have their information grouped and have control on both ends. It is required to have at least one user registered to create credentials.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Developer Token given on the developer.

args.name: userId
args.info: Id of the user.

args.name: idExternal
args.info: External ID, this field can be null and be used to keep track of that user with an external ID.

args.name: name
args.info: User name.

blocks.name: deleteUser
blocks.description: Deletes a user.Users are logical segmentations for end-users. It's a best practice to register users in order to have their information grouped and have control on both ends. It is required to have at least one user registered to create credentials.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Developer Token given on the developer.

args.name: userId
args.info: Id of the user.

blocks.name: validateSessionToken
blocks.description: Sessions are access tokens for the final user in order to consume Sync endpoints. Sessions expire after 5 minutes of inactivity and should be used for creating or updating credentials.

args.name: sessionToken
args.info: Session token, this value can be obtain using token and subtoken from get getSessionToken.

args.name: sessionToken
args.info: Session token, this value can be obtain using token and subtoken from get getSessionToken.

blocks.name: getCredentials
blocks.description: Returns register credentials.Credentials are the third-party data that is needed in order to authenticate with a third-party site. Credentials are encrypted upon arrival and won’t be available on any endpoint. Data pull from this endpoint is only complementary.

args.name: sessionToken
args.info: Session token, this value can be obtain using token and subtoken from get getSessionToken.

blocks.name: createCredentials
blocks.description: Creates credentials.Credentials are the third-party data that is needed in order to authenticate with a third-party site. Credentials are encrypted upon arrival and won’t be available on any endpoint. Data pull from this endpoint is only complementary.

args.name: sessionToken
args.info: Session token, this value can be obtain using token and subtoken from get getSessionToken.

args.name: idSite
args.info: Site ID.

args.name: credentials
args.info: Credentials Object (this must be created using the credentials field of the Site ID provided).

blocks.name: updateCredentials
blocks.description: Updates credentials.Credentials are the third-party data that is needed in order to authenticate with a third-party site. Credentials are encrypted upon arrival and won’t be available on any endpoint. Data pull from this endpoint is only complementary.

args.name: sessionToken
args.info: Session token, this value can be obtain using token and subtoken from get getSessionToken.

args.name: idSite
args.info: Site ID.

args.name: credentials
args.info: Credentials Object (this must be created using the credentials field of the Site ID provided).

blocks.name: deleteCredentials
blocks.description: Delete credentials.Credentials are the third-party data that is needed in order to authenticate with a third-party site. Credentials are encrypted upon arrival and won’t be available on any endpoint. Data pull from this endpoint is only complementary.

args.name: sessionToken
args.info: Session token, this value can be obtain using token and subtoken from get getSessionToken.

args.name: idCredential
args.info: Id of the credentials.

blocks.name: getAccounts
blocks.description: Returns accounts for a specific user.Accounts are repositories for end-user transactions which are often segmented by some distinction, such as account type and/or account number. Account and transactional data can be retrieved from third-party sites (refreshed) up to three times a day.

args.name: sessionToken
args.info: Session token, this value can be obtain using token and subtoken from get getSessionToken.

args.name: idAccount
args.info: Account ID.

args.name: idCredential
args.info: Credential ID.

args.name: idSite
args.info: Site ID.

args.name: idSiteOrganization
args.info: Site Organization ID.

args.name: idSiteOrganizationType
args.info: Site Organization Type ID.

args.name: isDisable
args.info: Is disable, some sites can have the option to retreieve transactions that are not longer valid, active, etc.

args.name: fields
args.info: Select fields to be returned.

args.name: skip
args.info: Skip rows to be returned.

args.name: limit
args.info: Limit the number of rows to be returned.

args.name: order
args.info: Order the rows to be returned.

args.name: keywords
args.info: Filters by keywords.

args.name: skipKeywords
args.info: Filters by keywords.

blocks.name: getTransactions
blocks.description: Returns transactions for specific user.Transactions are financial movements that are related to an account. They reflect an income or expense that the end-user has on a specific site. The amount of historical data Sync retrieves will vary by source, but most often 60 days of transactions will be available.

args.name: sessionToken
args.info: Session token, this value can be obtain using token and subtoken from get getSessionToken.

args.name: idTransaction
args.info: Filters by transaction ID.

args.name: idAccount
args.info: Account ID.

args.name: idCredential
args.info: Credential ID.

args.name: idSite
args.info: Site ID.

args.name: idSiteOrganization
args.info: Site Organization ID.

args.name: idSiteOrganizationType
args.info: Site Organization Type ID.

args.name: isDisable
args.info: Filters by disable transaction.

args.name: hasAttachment
args.info: Filters by transactions with valid attachments.

args.name: hasAttachment
args.info: Filters by transactions with valid attachments.

args.name: dtRefreshFrom
args.info: Filters by transaction refresh date, expected UNIX timestamp.

args.name: dtRefreshTo
args.info: Filters by transaction refresh date, expected UNIX timestamp.

args.name: dtTransactionFrom
args.info: Filters by transaction date, expected UNIX timestamp.

args.name: dtTransactionTo
args.info: Filters by transaction date, expected UNIX timestamp.

args.name: fields
args.info: Select fields to be returned.

args.name: skip
args.info: Skip rows to be returned.

args.name: limit
args.info: Limit the number of rows to be returned.

args.name: order
args.info: Order the rows to be returned.

args.name: keywords
args.info: Filters by keywords.

args.name: skipKeywords
args.info: Filters by keywords.

blocks.name: getTransactionsCount
blocks.description: Returns the number of transactions given some search parameters.Transactions are financial movements that are related to an account. They reflect an income or expense that the end-user has on a specific site. The amount of historical data Sync retrieves will vary by source, but most often 60 days of transactions will be available.

blocks.name: createTaxpayer
blocks.description: Create a new taxpayer.With these endpoint you can add or edit taxpayers that will be able to emit invoices.

args.name: sessionToken
args.info: Session token, this value can be obtain using token and subtoken from get getSessionToken.

args.name: taxpayer
args.info: The RFC of the taxpayer e.g.(AAA010101AAA).

args.name: key
args.info: Key of the certificate (string encoded in base64).

args.name: cer
args.info: Certificate of the taxpayer (string encoded in base64).

args.name: password
args.info: Password of the cer and key.

blocks.name: updateTaxpayer
blocks.description: Update the credentials of taxpayer.With these endpoint you can add or edit taxpayers that will be able to emit invoices.

args.name: sessionToken
args.info: Session token, this value can be obtain using token and subtoken from get getSessionToken.

args.name: key
args.info: Key of the certificate (string encoded in base64).

args.name: taxpayer
args.info: The RFC of the taxpayer e.g.(AAA010101AAA).

args.name: cer
args.info: Certificate of the taxpayer (string encoded in base64).

args.name: password
args.info: Password of the cer and key.

blocks.name: getTaxpayers
blocks.description: Get the list of the registered taxpayers for the user.With these endpoint you can add or edit taxpayers that will be able to emit invoices.

args.name: sessionToken
args.info: Session token, this value can be obtain using token and subtoken from get getSessionToken.

args.name: taxpayer
args.info: The RFC of the taxpayer e.g.(AAA010101AAA).

args.name: cer
args.info: Certificate of the taxpayer (string encoded in base64).

args.name: password
args.info: Password of the cer and key.

blocks.name: stampNewInvoice
blocks.description: Stamp a new invoice, you can send the JSON structure.

args.name: sessionToken
args.info: Session token, this value can be obtain using token and subtoken from get getSessionToken.

args.name: invoiceData
args.info: JSON structure of the invoice.

args.name: invoiceXml
args.info: XML string (base64 encoded).

args.name: idProvider
args.info: Id or name of the available providers in Sync.

blocks.name: checkStructure
blocks.description: Check for errors and warning in JSON structure or XML invoice.

args.name: sessionToken
args.info: Session token, this value can be obtain using token and subtoken from get getSessionToken.

args.name: invoiceData
args.info: JSON structure of the invoice.

args.name: invoiceXml
args.info: XML string (base64 encoded).

blocks.name: getAllStampedInvoices
blocks.description: Get all the stamped invoices for the user.

args.name: sessionToken
args.info: Session token, this value can be obtain using token and subtoken from get getSessionToken.

args.name: uuid
args.info: UUID of the invoice.

args.name: issuer
args.info: Filter by the RFC of the issuer.

args.name: dtCreateFrom
args.info: Filter from the date when the invoice was stamped, expected UNIX timestamp.

args.name: dtCreateTo
args.info: Filter to the date when the invoice was stamped.

args.name: dtRegisterFrom
args.info: Filter by the start of the register date, expected UNIX timestamp.

args.name: dtRegisterTo
args.info: Filter by the end of the register date, expected UNIX timestamp.

args.name: recipient
args.info: Filter by the RFC of the recipient.

blocks.name: cancelInvoice
blocks.description: Cancel the invoice.

args.name: sessionToken
args.info: Session token, this value can be obtain using token and subtoken from get getSessionToken.

args.name: uuid
args.info: UUID of the invoice.

blocks.name: getProviders
blocks.description: In Sync you can use different providers to stamp the invoices.

args.name: sessionToken
args.info: Session token, this value can be obtain using token and subtoken from get getSessionToken.
